verses.roman:
manvantaraṁ manur devā
manu-putrāḥ sureśvarāḥ
rṣayo 'ṁśāvatārāś ca
hareḥ ṣaḍ-vidham ucyate

synonyms: manu-antaram—the reign of each Manu; manuḥ—the Manu; devāḥ—the demigods; manu-putrāḥ—the sons of Manu; sura-īśvarāḥ—the different Indras; ṛṣayaḥ—the chief sages; aṁśa-avatārāḥ—the incarnations of portions of the Supreme Lord; ca—and; hareḥ—of Lord Hari; ṣaṭ-vidham—sixfold; ucyate—is said.
translation: In each reign of Manu, six types of personalities appear as manifestations of Lord Hari: the ruling Manu, the chief demigods, the sons of Manu, Indra, the great sages and the partial incarnations of the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
